item.title: IEA 'Cautiously Optimistic' About Natural Gas Supplies
item.description: IEA said well-stocked natural gas inventories and demand reductions are reasons for “cautious optimism” about supplies.

item.title: Oil Stages Modest Rebound Following Dramatic Slump
item.description: Oil prices rebounded somewhat in Europe, but continued volatility suggests investors remain jumpy about the outlook for crude.

item.title: Gold Climbs Amid Falling Treasury Yields
item.description: Base metals and gold moved higher in Europe, with traders optimistic the Fed has finished its current hiking cycle and will hold rates for the time being.

item.title: Volkswagen Performance Might Fizzle Out as Pricing Normalizes
item.description: Volkswagen’s first-quarter earnings beat consensus expectations, but its confirmed guidance suggests the company’s performance will probably decelerate as prices normalize over the rest of the year, RBC said.

item.title: Dollar Expected to Weaken Further as US Rate Cuts Loom
item.description: The dollar was lower in Europe and many analysts expect it to drop further after the Fed raised interest rates but omitted to mention that additional policy firming may be necessary.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Barely Move After Fed, Before ECB Meetings
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were broadly flat after the Fed delivered a 25 basis-point rate rise, as expected, and with the ECB likely to follow suit later on Thursday.

item.title: Shell Earnings Top Views, Details Buyback
item.description: Shell announced a $4 billion share buyback and reported first-quarter adjusted earnings of $9.7 billion, beating expectations, but falling on quarter due to tax movements and lower prices.

item.title: Maersk Weighed by Slide in Freight Rates, Volumes
item.description: Maersk reported a sharp drop in first-quarter net profit to $2.3 billion, as inventory corrections in western economies caused shipping demand to normalize, pushing freight rates and volumes lower.

item.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Rises; Both Exports and Imports Fall
item.description: Germany’s adjusted trade surplus climbed to €17 billion in March, with exports falling by a much bigger-than-expected 5.2%, reflecting a slide in the global demand for the country’s manufactured goods.

item.title: BMW Keeps Outlook After Solid First Quarter
item.description: BMW confirmed its forecast of an 8%-10% underlying earnings margin for its automotive segment in 2023 after it reported higher revenues and profits in the first quarter on good pricing and sales of top-end and electric vehicles.

item.title: Rheinmetall Backs Guidance After Sales Boost
item.description: Rheinmetall targeted an operating margin of roughly 12% this year and confirmed its forecast of significant sales growth after demand for military procurement increased following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Volkswagen Confirms Guidance After Strong Sales Growth
item.description: Volkswagen confirmed its financial targets for 2023 after reporting a 35% rise in underlying operating profit to €7 billion, as revenue jumped on strong demand for its cars in Europe and North America.

item.title: ArcelorMittal Upbeat as First Quarter Tops Hopes
item.description: ArcelorMittal reported above-forecast first-quarter results, helped by a rebound in steel spreads as market conditions improved, and said it expected profits to increase further in the second quarter.

item.title: Rio Tinto Likes Lithium, But Cautious on Growing via Deals
item.description: The CEO of Rio Tinto said he was interested in expanding the company’s lithium business, but mindful of paying too much for more of the battery material used to power electric cars.

item.title: AB InBev Earnings Boosted by Revenue Beat
item.description: AB InBev reported a 14% rise in normalized earnings to $4.8 billion on above-forecast organic revenue growth, and said it expected 2023 Ebitda to gain in line with its medium-term outlook of 4%-8%.

item.title: As Bosses Reach for AI Tools, They Need to Be Smart About It
item.description: Artificial-intelligence software can lend executives a hand but risks losing that human touch.

item.title: The Boss's Intelligence Might Be Artificial
item.description: Tools like ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence can save executives time, or reflect poorly on their leadership.

item.title: Treasury yields fell and U.S. stocks ended lower in the wake of the meeting, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 0.7%, 0.5% and 0.8%, respectively.
item.description: Treasury yields fell and U.S. stocks ended lower in the wake of the meeting, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 0.7%, 0.5% and 0.8%, respectively.

item.title: The SEC voted 3-2 to adopt a rule requiring more disclosure from public companies about share repurchases starting in the fourth quarter, Washington's latest move to rein in such transactions.
item.description: The SEC voted 3-2 to adopt a rule requiring more disclosure from public companies about share repurchases starting in the fourth quarter, Washington’s latest move to rein in such transactions.

item.title: The World Bank's executive board approved Ajay Banga as its next president, putting him in charge of an effort to expand lending capacity and fight climate change.
item.description: The World Bank’s executive board approved Ajay Banga as its next president, putting him in charge of an effort to expand lending capacity and fight climate change.
